name: Dr. Anthony J. Lee
text: I am a Lecturer and The University of Stirling and been part of the division since 2019. I completed my PhD at The University of Queensland in 2015 and was a Marie Curie Fellow at The University of Glasgow. I have expertise in many statistical techniques, such as linear mixed effects modelling. Outside the lab, I am the current president of the Glasgow Giants Australian Rules Football Club.

name: Interested in joining the lab?
text: There are often opportunities to work in the lab, including a three-year PhD degree and various one-year Masters degrees. If you are interested in finding out more about opportunities to join the lab, please email me.

name: Quantitative Methods for Psychological Research
text: I teach a quantitative methods module using R. All R content taught on this module can be accessed here.

name: Human Facial Attractiveness
text: This study is part of undergraduate dissertation projects investigating factors that influence human facial attractiveness. This survey takes approximately 30 minutes. You can access the survey here.
